description:
I always get the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles. It's amazing! I can't get myself to try anything else because I crave it. 

Tonight I did pick up instead of ubereats. When I got home I had the wrong order. I called and they were super nice and apologized and immediately offered to DELIVER the right order and told me to enjoy the wrong one. I was so surprised by how responsive they were. Hot food delivered 20 minutes after my call to complain.
author: Tricia K.

description: Great for takeout! Quick, easy, and yummy. I love the garlic noodles and the vermicelli.
author: AC R.

description:
For some odd reason I've been craving things recently, and tonight I really wanted some pho broth.

I got the pho with five spice chicken and the garlic noodles as a side. I actually went straight for the broth-- without the noodles, it was a bit salty, as was to be expected. It was not the lightest broth I had, but left me feeling satiated. The green onions in it had been there for a bit, as they were somewhat waterlogged. This one lacked some of the complexity of flavor I've had in other broths (the lemongrass, different layers, etc.) but I understand pho is not their main focus. 3.25/5.

Once in a while, you rediscover chicken that is just so juicy and delicious that it's hard to put down. This five spice chicken is exactly that. Crispy on the outside (with skin!), moist on the inside, and in generous portions. I'll definitely be back for this. 4/5.

Garlic noodles weren't omg amazing, but I can understand the appeal of buttery, aromatic carbs. There were real little garlic bits on this too. It's the sort of food you eat when you want a pick me up and can't bring yourself to eat healthy. 3.5/5.

Echoing the large portions that other have pointed out. Even though the name threw me off a bit since it's not traditionally...Vietnamese(?), I would come back for that chicken. 3.5/5.
author: Nicole H.

description:
For a simple individual, the name of the restaurant sounds a bit trendy. At least the name does.

But when you walk in it is not really, especially along the lengthy Haight Street corridor where majority of the businesess are casual and laid back. There are also some good restaurants and businesses too. Alnd you thought that Haight/Ashbury is all about the Summer of Love. "Rock on, dude!"

This Vietnamese restaurant is operated by Cantonese speaking people. And these cats can make some good authentic Vietnamese dishes. 

I was here for an early dinner with the restaurant being quiet. You place your order through the cashier. Looking at the extensive menu posted on the wall and behind the cashier and right below the kitchen, every dish looked and sounds so good. After a lengthy self-debate, I ordered the Five-spiced chicken over garlic noodles. For $12.50, the chicken was marinaded and spiced with five different kind of spices. The chicken was moist, grilled very nicely and not overly burnt. I had garlic noodles from many restaurants, but this restaurant's version was very subtle with a perfect of garlic. The pasta was also cooked al' dente style, which I liked and strongly preferred in my pasta dishes. 

The restaurant also served bottled beers. I also added San Francisco's own Anchor Steam's "Go West" IPA for $6.00. This is a really good brew with my meal.

Take outs, meal pick-ups and deliveries are also available and very popular with various ride-services doing deliveries. 

Despite the median rating, I really had a blast here. And I may return to try other meals from here.
author: Matt G.

description:
I've been to Perilla several times, this location and the one on Mission St. and this location consistently fails to provide quality food. I had just eaten at the Mission location last week and was craving more garlic noodles and beef after work. However, the Mission St. location closes at 3 pm. Huge bummer because it's in a great, convenient location. 

Anyways, decided to go to the Haight location because I'd been there before and hoped that the food would taste similar-ish. Boy was I wrong. Not sure if management has changed or if the food had been sitting around for a long time but the food was straight up cold. Not even warm. AND the portion of meat was much less than the other location. The garlic noodles were barely flavored and the meat was not flavorful (as it's supposed to be). :( paid $15 and spent 20 minutes driving for meager portions and bland food. Definitely won't be returning to this location. Save your money for the other locations or for a better meal elsewhere.
author: Saachi G.

description: Fast, friendly service. Plenty of seating. Good sized portions and reasonable prices. A go to Vietnamese place in The neighborhood!
author: Katie L.

description:
I just got UberEats delivery from here, which lists this restaurant as "Rollz & Bowlz", marketed as Asian fusion. I was pissed off enough about the flagrant misrepresentation, but beyond that, the food was just hot garbage.

Imperial Rolls: they should be renamed to ass rolls. There's nothing imperial about them. They literally taste like ass. They're still on my desk, and looking at them makes me angry and vaguely nauseated.

Garlic Noodle with Chicken and Broccoli: the chicken is reasonably tender and nicely crispy on the outside, but that's not a sufficiently redeeming quality. The noodles are carelessly half-fried, greasy, and taste of cheap imitation garlic, reminding of the perennial disappointment when ordering "garlic fries" only to be given fries that were obviously prepared with zero garlic whatsoever. The plastic garbage container in which this meal was delivered also contained three pieces of steamed broccoli, which I had to resign myself to.

It is severely disappointing to order takeout and to have to let go 90% of the meal because it is totally inedible. I actually had to walk the remains over to a trashcan on the other side of the building because the smell would bother me if I were to put it in the trashcan by my desk.
author: John L.

description: I dont usually post a review, but i found a rusted metal piece in my soup. Not cool! Now I'm worried if i'm going to get sick or something.
author: Denise A.

description: For lower Haight Vietnamese, I think this is it. My go to fish here is the 5 spiced chicken with rice. I like the imperial rolls also. I have tried the noodle satay but it's a bit spicy for me. Worth a try.
author: Manny Y.

description:
This restaurant is never crowded and you get your food quickly, so I like to come here once in a while for a quick dinner. Staff is nice and the place is clean.

My boyfriend and I have tried the garlic noodles with five spice chicken, imperial rolls, fresh rolls with veggie and shrimp fresh rolls. 
The garlic noodles are good, a little bit oily but really tasty. The five spice chicken is ok, some bits are crunchy which I liked. 
For the imperial rolls, they misunderstood that we wanted it along the garlic noodles (smaller portion for a smaller price) so we got the full order. I don't really like fried rolls and those were no exception. I feel like I never know what goes inside and the greasiness annoys me.
The fresh rolls, on the other hand, are fresh, crunchy and tasty. Not the best ones I've had but good! The home sauce that comes with them is great too, a little bit sweet.

I will come back to this place for a quick and simple dinner.
author: Coralie S.

description: So yummy. The chicken was to die for. The skin was super crispy and the rice was just sticky enough. The service was quick and the owner had a nice smile. I used the bathroom and it was clean. That a big bonus.
author: Lisa G.

description: My boyfriend and I came here because San Tung was closed and it was right down the street. We were looking forward to the garlic noodles because it's something we heard they were known for. I remember thinking how oily it was but that it was still tasty. Later on we both had quite a bit of indigestion the rest of the day and usually I'd say my boyfriend has a pretty strong stomach? Overall it was decent Vietnamese food but nothing special.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Food: 
Tried the garlic noodles with the five spice chicken and imperial rolls. The chicken was so flavorful with a crispy skin and moist, tender meat. The imperial rolls were also a hit. The noodles were a bit of a let down for me though. They could have used more garlic and we're pretty bland. 

Service: 
Great, prompt service. They refilled our waters multiple times and were friendly. 

Ambiance: 
Pretty decently sized for an Asian restaurant in the city. It was clean and had simple decor. A group of 4 can sit very comfortably.
author: Susan G.

description: Excellent food, good portions, great price! Michael and his "family" of front staff and cooks do an excellent job and hold hospitality close to their heart and their food comes from love Cheers... Enjoy!
author: Sean M.

description: I love garlic noodles and that's the main reason I come to this Perilla. The first couple of times I've been here the food was okay. However, the last few times I've come here for dinner I've noticed that the quality of the food has been declining. The noodles are okay but the chicken has been over cooked and hard like jerky. Unfortunately this has been pretty consistent with all of my recent visits. The people I've dine here with didn't really enjoy there food either. I think I am giving up on this restaurant particularly since I can get better quality food for the same price. So contributing my final review.
author: Scott T.

description: Are you ever on your way home, hungry, don't have anything to eat at home, but don't have time to prepare anything since you have other stuff to do? I wish there was a Perilla there anytime I am in this situation. They serve really yummy food for a decent price. If you're dining in and grabbing/going, do yourself a favor and get the Five Spice Chicken with Garlic Noodles and have a great life. Enough said.
author: Marlon T.

description: Ordered imperial roll to go with my chicken and noodles. When I got home, it wasn't there. Sooo annoying. OK food. Nothing to write home about.
author: Tessa D.

description: Solid grub. Soup lacks gelatin but tasty and good value. Nice guy runs the place. Recommend.
author: reza n.

description:
Pros:
Big bowl of pho
5 spice chicken is bomb.com
Workers are really nice
They gave me extra spicy chili paste when I requested to add something spicy
Thin and thick noodles (you can choose!)

Cons:
The noodle soup is flavorless :(

So bummed!! Everything was looking so good but then the soup itself was the most flavorless pho I've ever had. I kept trying to add things (soy sauce, hoisin sauce, chili paste) and it just wasn't doing it.

The 5 spice chicken on the other hand was the best chicken I've ever receive with a bowl of pho. If I were to go back, I'd maybe try garlic noodles or some other menu.
author: Kelly G.

description: I had the beef and five spice chicken with broccoli. The beef and chicken are very flavorful. The chicken in particular has a crispy skin yet the meat is tender and moist. Five stars for the five spice chicken! I frequently visited their other restaurant in the financial district and their food and flavors are pretty consistent.
author: Hakim R.

description:
Wow, just got a chicken cabbage salad from Perilla on Haight.  Note I've been eating this salad for YEARS, but from other locations.

I received a pathetic amount of chicken on this salad.  Do not order the chicken salad from Haight Street.  You will be disappointed.  See my picture for an idea of what I am talking about.
author: joe b.

description: We got our food so fast! We even ordered at the wrong location and the Irving st location helped us correct our mistake! Good food, honest, delicious, hot and tasty!
author: dy D.

description: The food here is very good and the staff is really friendly and portions are big.  I wish they had more vegetarian options would be my only complaint.
author: Michele W.

description:
Review for a catering order for a meetup. Ordered three items for a group of 10: the veggie vermicelli noodles, chicken vermicelli, and veggie spring rolls. With delivery and tip it was about $20 a head which was not bad considering we had lots of leftovers.

Chicken had crispy skin, tasty spiced but not hot seasoning. Looked like dark thigh or leg meat, a little on the dry and tough side. The pan had a generous amount of rice noodles but not skimpy on the chicken either. Veggie pan had cabbage, mushroom, bean sprouts, green onions. Both had crushed peanuts in a container on the side to sprinkle on. The veggie dish was lacking in more tofu or protein. Spring rolls were great! Wrapped in rice paper, cut in half with same as the veggie dish but more slivers of tofu and bean curd.

Not bad, tasty food, good service. Dishes were a little too greasy and not very fresh, but that's to be expected for a catering order.
author: Truc N.

description: I wish I could give it zero stars. Ordered delivery tonight, it took over an hour to start. Opened it up and it was horrible:-/. Ordered the veggie fresh rolls, they were straight up lettuce wrapped in rice paper. The prawn satay pho was 5 burned shrimp with lettuce( lettuce in pho???) and noodles and the broth was so greasy it was just pure fat. The restaurant refused to give us our money back and because it was all inedible, we had to throw it in the trash.  I have never thrown away delivery food before and I did this evening. Never will order from here again, there are so many great Vietnamese places in the city, so I'm not sure how this place survives.  Added photos to see for yourself.
author: Marta S.

description: Great people, great food. Beef combo satay cures all ailments. Serious Sculpin beer selection too.
author: Taylor R.

description:
Did you know that Perilla is the name of a fine American bistro-style restaurant run by a former "Top Chef" winner (review: http://bit.ly/1KF85hu)? It's really excellent, but that place is in the West Village in NYC and doesn't have anything to do with this place so who cares? No, the only thing in common is the name, and this Perilla is related to the two other locations on Irving Street in the Inner Sunset and on Mission near 2nd. It's the Mission Street location that has provoked me to have a long-running hankering for Five-Spice Chicken with Garlic Noodles, but the problem is that it's only open until 3PM.

My hankerings usually occur after work, so that was a perennial bummer until I discovered that this Perilla is open for dinner until 9PM. Got it so far? Anyway, the best part is that it's an easy 6 or 7 MUNI ride away from Downtown. It's in that convenient hub of eateries in the Lower Haight where Wonderland, Taqueria Estrella, Cafe International and now Stone House are. When I first walked in, the place looked somehow incomplete as if they were still waiting for their Cost Plus home decor shipment. But the menu was complete, and like the Mission Street location, you go up and order at the front counter.

It's probably not a shocker that I ordered the $11 Five-Spice Chicken and Garlic and Butter Infused Noodles (photo: http://bit.ly/1KF7Ra4). How exactly do you infuse butter into a noodle? Is there a woman back there with a hypodermic needle and steady hand giving each strand a shot? Well, whatever they do, it's worth it because the thick buttery noodles draw me back to Perilla time and again. So does the chicken which never fails to be plump and juicy with the right amount of crisp on the skin. The broccoli always tastes like an afterthought but it doesn't matter because I can have this dish for dinner now. It'a all about me.

FOOD - 4 stars...they infuse butter into their noodles and plump up their chicken...delish
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...kinda bare bones but who cares?
SERVICE - 4 stars...you can tell they pay attention to their customers here
TOTAL - 4 stars...it's what's for dinner
author: Ed U.

description: Service was great! Food was delicious. We ordered the combo rolls and the Chicken Curry Ramen soooooooooo soooooo delicious. I can't wait to come back again! Thank you
author: Charlotte D.

description:
I like this place
The food is good, prices are reasonable for SF and the larger than hole-in-the-wall seating inside isn't run down or dirty
Ordered take-out beef vermicelli entree through eat24 and used a $2 coupon you can find on retailmenot and boom $11 out the door and I'm fed
thumbs up
author: G K.

description:
I've passed by this place many times given that it's on a busy street and finally gave it a shot. I came here on a Thursday night and ordered the rare beef pho. I must reasonably say that this is one of the least appetizing bowls of pho I've had in the Bay Area. There was no complexity to the broth that you would normally get at a respectable pho restaurant. It was bland and seemed very watered down. The noodles also tasted off. Furthermore, there was barely any cilantro and they didn't offer bean sprouts or basil. Seemed very odd to me, especially since none of them were in the bowl when they served it.

All in all, it was very far from any authentic bowl of pho you can find in the Bay Area. It's also very overpriced for pho.. $12? I can usually find some legit ones for $9 tops elsewhere.
author: Megan G.

description: This a great place for doing GrubHub and also since its less crowded, it is a good option to have meals in the evening time. Quite fast service and clean place. Being vegetarian, I have few options to select from. The vegetable noodle soup is really well made. I live the way they saute the vegetables and also the broth is delicious!! Apart from that, my husband and me usually order there fresh rolls and garlic noodles. The garlic noodles is tasty and garlicy of course, but a bit oily. Usually our favorite place for a quick dinner or a take out.
author: Foram C.

description: Extremely dissatisfied and disappointed. Waste of money. The broth was too oily to consume. They didn't pack a spoon with my boba making it much more difficult to fully enjoy the drink. We ordered and were charged (dollar more per) for soda in bottles, but were delivered cans. Overall awful experience. Would NOT recommend.
author: Bronwyn W.

description:
I don't want to give this place one star because the staff was friendly and attentive, however since San Francisco is such an expensive city and there are so many other choices to get a good meal, it warrants it.

The food: my friend and I both got the noodle/salad bowls: mostly noodles and some lettuce (and maybe a tablespoon of cucumbers). 
Mine was a vegetarian with crispy vegetable imperial rolls -unfortunately I could barely stomach the rolls  - the fillings consisted of mushy flavorless veggies or something. The vegetarian sauce was especially sweet and could barely stomach that. 
Friend's was chicken -not a whole lot of chicken and he at first though there was no salad b/c there were was mostly noodles. 

We both had enough to take home but opted not to  - to me this says a lot. 

And it's not cheap - each meal was about $13 with tax. (And for comparison, one can get a nice Thai dish for that amount).  

I really want to support local businesses but I can't support bad food.
author: MissyE X.

description:
#27/2016

I've enjoyed Perilla's addictive 5-spice chicken and garlic noodles for years: Juicy, flavorful, succulent slices of chicken that I've tried to duplicate in my kitchen but haven't (yet!) been successful. 

Paired with buttery garlic noodles studded with so much minced garlic, you could walk through Golden Gate park at night and scare away vampires.  

The combination is truly delicious and I seem to order only that for the past few years.

But, I have broken from habit or ordered a different dinner for little one and we've had the grilled prawns and vermicelli (I recall it was light on the amount of shrimp), the grilled pork and garlic noodles (very good) and had my socks knocked off by the yellow curry chicken soup, comforting on a cold and rainy day.

Appetizers are just ok except for the grilled pork rolls which are very savory, especially with the vinegary dipping sauce. 

Extremely disappointing are Perilla's Imperial rolls. Being a Vietnamese restaurant, this classic dish should be a slam-dunk but Perilla's are anything but: Rubbery, almost chalky, as opposed to crispy-crunchy and savory, there's something really wrong with their recipe and it's wrong in both the Irving Street and Haight Street locations.

Conversely, their Thai iced tea is wonderful, the perfect meal accompaniment/dessert.

3.5 stars rounded up to 4 stars for the extra good service (both at the restaurants and for delivery) and for their 5-spice "crack" chicken.

Perilla's chicken really is the bomb.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Unfortunately this is probably the worst restaurant I have ever eaten at in SF. I got the pho, garlic noodles, and Thai iced tea. The Thai iced tea was horrible and unsweetened. The pho unfortunately did not have much flavor. The garlic noodles was the best out of all of the items. There is just noting great about the food here which is rather sad.
author: Vanessa P.

description:
Ordered takeout from Perilla and the delivery was very quick which is always a plus! Portion sizes were great - not too big but not small. 

The Imperial Rolls included 3 rolls which were cut in half. Rolls were perfectly fried. Crispy and filled with ground pork, taro, carrots, and silver noodles with a side of sauce for dipping. Great appetizer if you like savory, crispy bites!

I ordered the Curry Chicken Garlic Noodles for myself. The garlic noodles were delicious but could have been a little more garlic-y in my opinion. The curry had chicken and potatoes in a "spicy coconut milk curry broth." Curry was good but it definitely was not spicy at all which was a bit of a let down. Had very mild flavor. 

Next time I think I'll try the Five Spice Chicken since it seems to be very popular! And of course the Imperial Rolls - those were tasty!
author: Chisholm T.

description: We have tried pork pho a couple of times here, it is made well with fresh ingredients.
author: Moslem L.

description: A lot has been said about the Garlic Noodles (which are indeed amazing), but the Satay Noodles are literally second to none. It is so satisfyingly savory. I've not found anything like it in the Bay Area. The restaurant is a very comfortable place, great for anything from grabbing a bite by yourself to having a casual get together with a few friends.
author: Keith M.

description:
Garlic noodles with five spice chicken - 3.5 stars
Thought the chicken was really good; nice and tender, fried well with good flavor. Thought the noodles were lacking though. It needed more butter and oil (and I usually don't want a lot of butter or oil in my noodles). As a result, it was a bit more dry than I would have wanted.

Vermicelli noodles with sautéed vegetables - 3.5 stars
Overall okay/slightly above average, though wished it had more sautéed vegetables. 

Cabbage with fried tofu - 3 stars
Definitely just average. Came with lots of cabbage (probably too much) and some fried tofu (could use more) and fish sauce or soy sauce. Wouldn't recommend this appetizer, as it was on the dry and bland side.

Service was great though, even though it's the kind of restaurant where you order first and then grab a seat. The owner (?) checked on us a good number of times and was very friendly. Based on these reviews, would give it a 3.5 overall. Decided to round up because it's a new restaurant, has vegan options, had good service, and I want to see them succeed. Would try again, and hope some of the items improve (it is a new store).
author: Will H.

description: I ordered the vegetable pho with veggie broth. It was definitely different than I'm used to- no bean sprouts, onion, and cilantro as is typical with pho and the veggies were atypical as well (cauliflower instead of broccoli, no bok choy, etc.) but it was still delicious. The broth was really good and flavorful unlike a lot of veggie broths. The staff was very friendly too! Only not getting 5 stars because I really wish I had the bean sprouts/onion/cilantro but since it was to go I didn't notice until I got home.
author: Sarah L.

description: I asked what the most popular dish is - beef garlic noodles. I decided on the shrimp garlic noodles. *(for seafood lovers). Yummy! We also ordered the shrimp spring rolls. Vermicelli was a bit on the dry side. The portions of the entrees are quite smaller than most Vietnamese, but it was surprisingly filling and delicious. Service was attentive and great.
author: Lydia V.

description:
Iza's line was way too long. It was cold and rainy so we opted for Perilla instead. I can't say I was thrilled about my meal. I would probably be more satisfied at PPQ. 

Interesting set up. You order, grab a number, and the food is brought to your table.

The curry chicken noodle soup was bland. The curry flavor was barely noticeable and they use chunks of chicken thigh. I'd personally prefer white meat chicken, but hey, maybe that's just me. I couldn't finished mainly because I wasn't satisfied with the flavors. 

The garlic noodles are standard to their sister restaurants but I felt the garlic flavor lacking in comparison to Swamp or PPQ Dungeness Island. 

My friend ordered the five spice chicken vermicelli. The chicken skin was rubbery and not crispy enough. Added the imperial rolls for $2.65 but really, it's adding ONE imperial roll for $2.65.

All in all, the meal seemed pretty pricey for 2 in terms of what you get. About $35 without drinks and tip.

Pro tip: 
Come after 6 for free metered parking. 

TLDR:
Go to PPQ if you're craving garlic noodles or pho.
author: Jessica L.

description:
This place is really good. I was so happy to find another location because the one on 1st st. in the financial district is only open certain days and only for lunch. 
The garlic noodles are so good. It's not greasy like some places. My favorite one is the grilled prawns with noodles. 
Perilla will be my new go to place when I'm craving vietnamese garlic noodles.
author: Edie G.

description:
The ambiance is nothing to praise, that part can be skipped over. The device as well. You order as soon as you get in and then they bring the food to your table. Nothing to really comment on here. 

The ACTUAL FOOD THO. it was great. The garlic noodles were nice and garlicky, just how I like it. The beef was tender and not too chewy, the five spice chicken was dark meat and had a nice crispy skin. I wish I hadn't shared my chicken, because the skin was that good. My only negative comment is that the broccoli was super cold, definitely on purpose cold, and I wasn't really vibing that. But seriously, the food is good and I recommend it.
author: Katrina O.

description:
Straight forward service. Nice people and a good atmosphere. Very esthetic small restaurant. Really liked it !
5 spice chicken was great!
author: Brendon N.

description:
If you love garlic noodles and a variety of beer, this is the place to go on Haight! Ownership provides a friendly service in this hip Vietnamese restaurant. I highly recommend the five-spice chicken or pork chop with any order, but you can't go wrong with any entree. Garlic noodles were full of flavor and very delicious. Portion size was perfect for our group of 4, as were able to share all dishes generously. The Imperial Rolls are a must for appetizers! Large selection of Ballast Point, too.

Perilla isn't open for lunch, so you'll have to come for dinner only. Parking might be hard to find, since most are hourly or meter parking, but isn't hard to find if you don't mind a walk of a few blocks. This place is great for catering and I believe you can order from here on several apps. Can't wait to come back and try more of the menu!
author: Joshua H.

description: This place is awesome! Garlic noodles were really flavorful. The chicken salad was also good with big chunks of chicken in there! Mike the owner served us and was the nicest guy. We will definitely go back.
author: Joseph W.

description: We got the food catered in our office and it did not taste good. Greasy, no flavor really. The beef and pork were so chewy too.
author: Parminder Nayyar C.

description:
Location blah 
Variety blah 
Price 

Food is alright. Only Vietnamese in the area. The coworkers and I decided to try it out one day. I ordered the imperial rolls ($8) the garlic noodles and five spice chicken. 

3 egg rolls for $8 that weren't special 
Noodles and chicken for $11 were pretty bland 

Coworkers tried the vermicelli bows which they said was alright. 
Bun mi was pricey but alright
author: Noel M.

description:
I've been to the Sunset location several times and love their vermicelli but this time we ordered from Caviar. We ordered a chicken vermicelli and a veggie vermicelli and shrimp rolls (these have mint in them btw). They ran out of veggie vermicelli and instead gave us 2 chicken vermicellis (sorry for not picking up the phone!)

I honestly really enjoyed the vermicelli, which was simple enough with salad, a huge bed of noodles, with juicy pieces of chicken on top. The sauce/dressing comes on the side. The meal tasted really light and fresh and best part of all, the portions were huge!
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
If you've ever eaten at a Perilla, you know what to expect. They serve a variety of different things, many of which you can find at other Vietnamese restaurants (rice plates, vermicelli bowls, rolls). But I come for the garlic noodles. Fun fact: garlic noodles are purportedly a San Francisco dish, originating from Thanh Long and Crustacean in the Sunset.

If you've never had Garlic Noodles before, I'm not sure how to describe it other than garlicy, buttery, and carby. I love them and know many others who love them as well. But I know just as many people who don't like them and find them bland and boring. I have never known a dish to be so polarizing! But my vote is for 'yummy', and I normally get them with the moist and flavorful Five Spice Chicken. But the pork is also a winner (never had it with beef, so can't comment on that end).

The prices are a bit higher than the Perilla Sunset prices, but I think on par with the Perilla Financial District prices. It does take quite a bit longer for the food to come out as well, versus the other two locations.

I really really wish they were open at lunchtime. Originally they did serve lunch, but apparently business was too slow and it wasn't worth it. They used to serve Banh Mi at lunch, which quickly went from $5, to $7 with a drink. It was a solid Banh Mi that took forever to make and was expensive (Dinosaurs prices!). I don't even know why I mention this, as it isn't on the menu anymore.

I would recommend for anyone who likes a heavier (and yes, greasier) Asian option. It has slower service and a pricier menu than you'd get in the Sunset. But I live here and not the Sunset, so I'm more than happy to pay extra for a closer place to get my garlic noodle fix.
author: Trish B.

description: Bland Vietnamese. Nothing special. Would recommend PPQ over this place, just as cheap and much more flavor.
author: Meg C.

description:
Food (4/5): My bf got the garlic noodles w/ five spice chicken, and I got the curry chicken noodle soup. I loved the soup, which was super flavorful and filling. They give a ton of noodles - I wish they gave more soup to match haha. But the chicken, potato, and noodles were all cooked really well! I opted for the wider noodles, but you can get thinner rice noodles as well.

My bf and I also loved the five spice chicken - it's pan-fried, I think, so it was moist but crispy on the outside. The garlic noodles were a little dry for my taste, and the broccoli was a bit undercooked, but overall I'd def get either of these dishes again.

Value (3/5): It's not that much food for $12+ haha, I think a fairer price would be $9. The soup is filling since they give you a ton of noodles, but I don't think either of us would've been full just with the garlic noodle dish.
author: Abby S.

description:
To sum up my experience here I'd say that I just wasted $40 on bad food and bad service. I wouldn't give this place any stars, but since it's not possible I had to give them one star.

When you first walk in they tell you to sit down anywhere you'd like then hand you a menu. Then they tell you to go to the front to order your food. We ordered chicken pho, beef pho, & a prawn vermicelli. We also ordered a Vietnamese iced coffee which was not your traditional Viet coffee. It was weak watered down coffee. All of the pho is made with a bland chicken broth. The "beef pho" was more like chicken pho with a side of barbecue beef, and did not taste good together. The beef was really salty, and no matter what, nothing seemed to make the broth taste better. The chicken pho was not seasoned properly and the chicken was dry. The vermicelli the best out the three dishes we had but still wasn't good. 

Overall, it was a bad experience and a waste of money. I will not be coming back here. Nor would I recommend this place.
author: Kirsten S.

description: Perilla on Haight! Best place on the block! I go here when I'm craving good Vietnamese food! Best garlic noodles in San Francisco! I really enjoy the owners, very professional and easy going! Not to mention they're extremely fast with orders! Food is always hot and fresh! Thank you Perilla for serving my taste buds every time!
author: Aarin P.

description: Very disappointing. Vegetable vermicelli was lacking the vegetables it supposedly had on the menu - no sprouts, no mint, no cucumber... Instead consisted of soggy carrots and cauliflower. No tofu either. All the food was overcooked, extremely salty, and very low quality for the high price.
author: Lukas C.

description:
We came here on a Saturday evening. It was busy but we got a nice table for two along the wall.  Service was very good.
My partner had pho and liked it very much while I had garlic noodles, also very good.
There is another Perilla in the Inner Sunset which is closer to our home, but this place was just fine.
author: Philip C.

description: Great for both take-out and dining in, Perilla serves up delicious pho and noodles. The owner Mike is incredibly friendly and kind, and they've got an impressive beer list as well. As a local in the Haight, you can't go wrong with Perilla.
author: Michael A.

description:
Closer to 2.5 stars but hell, I'll round up. It was my first time at this restaurant (from what I understand, there are others). It's a hybrid service establishment - order, get a number, sit down, stare at the encroaching bros on Haight St, food brought out to you. I'll break it down pho' sho'

The food:

- Rice/noodle based. No Bahn mi, but I saw an addition of another Pho dish. The vegetable over noodles was aiiite, nothing to get paroled early for 

The atmosphere:

- Fast food type of joint, service was pretty friendly. Front counter lady tried to be accommodating. Not the place to propose to your gf/bf/gerbil in

Why the 3 stars? I took 1.5 for them messing up my homie's order (and not fessing up until he called them out on it). The 0.5 is for being a chain-ish restaurant. Poopers.
author: Kenny H.

description:
Really good food with a great price. Their spring rolls have a ton of flavor despite how they look, and everything tastes very fresh. 

My wife got the rare beef pho and said it was also tasty. We had a bit of trouble with our delivery (entirely my fault) but these guys were super polite and helpful throughout the entire thing. 

We got our food, it was delicious, now I'm ready for more :)
author: Ben B.

description:
Garlic noodles were spectacular. The 5 spice Bahn Mi was a magnificent. 

Great Vietnamese place, clean, friendly and will 100% get my business again.

I have already told 4 people about it and I just left there.
author: A. D.

description:
This place sucks compared to the original perilla on Irving. Chicken broth with no flavor? Grilled meat on the side? 

The side meat is actually pretty flavorful but doesn't belong in a broth, more suited for a rice plate. 

Not sure how perilla allowed this location to open up with such a different menu and standards, tarnishing their name.

2 stars because it is not authentic and is not the perilla I was expecting.
author: Brad C.

description: Michael and the rest of the staff are awesome, very friendly and welcoming. There's a great beer selection, the beef pho is awesome and the garlic chicken is off the chain. Great local spot, relaxed and casual!
author: Justin K.

description:
I had been to the sister restaurant in the Sunset a while back and had not been impressed.
This place is similar: overpriced, greasy and not authentic Vietnamese. The casual setting is OK but doesn't make you want to stay and eat.  It will be my place to go when I am craving Vietnamese food but am too lazy to make it to the Tenderloin for the real deal..
author: Monkey B.

description:
This new Vietnamese place in Lower Haight cooked up super yummy food (I had the garlic pork shoulder) and a great service attitude, but a mediocre ambiance for the high prices. The furniture quality, lighting, and ordering at the counter make the ambiance mediocre. It feels a bit like a diner, and sure enough there was someone at a table working on their laptop. Maybe Perilla's lease is expensive, but I remember Tin in SOMA costs less, has nicer interior design, and full table service. That said, with this new Vietnamese spot and Iza Ramen coming soon, it's lovely to have variety from the status quo of Thai, Indian, and Sushi that has encompassed the neighborhood.

The prices are what stick for me to think twice before I go back. My beloved Lower Haight has more and more restaurants making lame sit-down attempts to justify high prices, while there are fewer places I can get an affordable meal to-go. I'd love to see Perilla try less on vanity, lower their prices, and draw in more volume by doubling their menu with an additional cuisine or salad bar.
author: Josh B.

description:
This place is different than the Irving location 

When you enter, you walk all the way to the back place the order. Pay. Then you get a number. Once you get a number, you find a place to sit. I feel like I'm at a food court

Food wasn't bad compare to Irving. Price, a little pricy for me.
author: Jasmin T.

description:
WOW, super impressed by this place.

First off, their service is incredible. We came for dinner halloween night so were pretty much as annoying a group as could be. We moved tables, took up another table to put our stuff on and the staff was still super nice and accommodating. The owner also kept giving us candy as a halloween treat! (the good chocolate kind!) 

As for their food, it was great as well, I got the garlic noodles with the charboiled beef and I think my friend fell in love with the beef. I on the other hand was a huge fan of the noodles. My only regret is I forgot my leftovers at my friends place and now I'm gonna be craving garlic noodles all week :(

Overall, loved this place, if I lived in SF, I would probably have garlic noodles once a week.
author: Lisa S.

description: The pork garlic noodles are amazing. The owner and staff are a treat to deal with, and the food comes out quickly. They also have an extensive beer collection. Thumbs up!
author: Kyle C.

description:
I have been waiting for a Vietnamese restaurant to open that's close enough for me to stumble to whenever I have the craving. Perilla fills this niche really well.

I ordered shrimp rolls, garlic noodles with five spice chicken, and vermicelli with grilled shrimp. I wanted a bánh mi- but they only serve these until 3. Darn. Now I'll have to come back to get one for lunch to be able to fully experience everything.

I took my food to go and the service was fast, friendly- beyond friendly- they were genuinely appreciative of my business, like for reals friendly. The food was great- fresh, great flavors, great portion size without skimping on the good stuff (shrimp, fresh herbs, meat).

I will be back!
author: Molly D.

description:
This Perilla is sort of like the new sibling to the ones in Inner Sunset and on Mission, but it's the first one I've attended to thus far. Needless to say, I was particularily stoked for it - happy to see a solid Vietnamese restaurant open relatively late (10pm everyday) only a few blocks from me. The reason I'm giving it four stars is because I think they still have a bit of organizing to do - my order was lost for a second and took a tad longer to get to me (30 minutes during low traffic hour) and I got up to refill my water while eating only to find one of the bussers thinking I was done with my over half full bowl and taking it back to the kitchen. Luckily, I caught her in time to let her know I was just filling up my water and will happily finish my food still. Even with those mishaps, everyone that worked there was so kind and smiling, the owner even came and asked me if I was enjoying the food. I think as they get more used to running their restaurant, it'll run more smoothly.

ONTO THE FOOD YAAASSSS. I ordered the Spicy Curry Chicken Noodle Soup. It looked aesthetically pleasing to say the least. The potatoes were perfectly cooked addition to the fall apart chicken and slightly creamy broth. With just a sprinkle of sriracha it became the perfect level of spice for me. At that point, restraining myself was a lost cause, and I managed to finish the entire bowl relatively quickly. A privilege for my tastebuds, a well worth it torture for my digestive system. I was extremely full, regretting I ate so fast, and yet overly content with the taste.

It was dinner, and I'd happily come back to call it such again here. If we were only allowed five words in our reviews I think I would say: Trust me, take your time.
author: Shayan S.

description: Really flavorful and traditional pho! The combo was excellent, and the spring rolls were well balanced with plenty of BBQ pork. Great service, clean restaurant, and not too crowded.
author: Duncan B.

description:
We sampled a couple dishes split family style between four friends. Everything was cooked perfectly! Perilla has several meat choices to go with their various dishes, so you really can't go wrong. Staff was super friendly and accommodating.

Recommend: 
- Imperial Rolls
- Papaya salad
- Pork chops (personal preference, but the chicken is also a popular choice!)
- Garlic noodles!! 

Parking is a little tricky, but there is street parking available pretty nearby!
author: Michelle W.

description: This place is just superb in terms of timing, ambiance, cleanliness & service. Reasonably priced & Decent. Awesome crew & so accommodating. Order online or use the menu! A sword and a shield is that they don't have a dessert menu. Lol! ;-)
author: R C.

description: Cold, mediocre, pre-cooked food in small portions at high prices. The owner and staff are friendly and we would love to have a good Vietnamese spot in the neighborhood. Unfortunately, this ain't it.
author: Alan M.

description: Glad there is a new location in lower haight. This place is a great resource for anyone looking to enjoy a solid bowl of pho. Also, they have GREAT options for veggie people. My guy loves their 5 spice chicken.
author: Emily P.

description: The food here was delicious! We ordered the papaya shrimp salad, combo rolls, beef garlic noodle and curry chicken garlic noodle. Michael the owner brought us out (ON THE HOUSE) Imperial rolls..they were fresh and very hot (temperature) and so delicious!! All of our food was very clean and healthy, garlic noodles are usually dripping with oil or butter very greasy..NoT here you, you can taste the butter and garlic but it's not visible!!! The beef was tender and very flavorful!! The curry chicken was spiced just right and very soothing! The combo rolls were clean and very tasty!! Michael also brought us a sample of his pho broth, we were both amazed how clean it tasted and you could actually taste the spices used in the broth!!! And don't let me forget about the sample of the 5 spice chicken!! AMAZING!  You must go try this restaurant!! If you like good clean healthy flavorful food...run don't walk to Perilla on haight!
author: Ellen T.

description: Soup was stone cold. Asked for a fresh bowl and they microwaved the first bowl ... then it was medium warm with mushy noodles. He stopped by to ask how it was and was surprised when we said "meh". We said it could use some spice and he told us we should have ordered jalapeños- then walked outside to smoke. Won't be back to this crap place.
author: T T.

description: Garlic noodles are the way to go. Don't get the soup, the broth is nothing special and the chicken is fatty. Not a place to take a date, lunch at best
author: Steve T.

description: Very quick delivery. Their Garlic Noodles with Pork is the best! And we loved the veggie spring rolls too.
author: Rachel T.

description: Love this place. This is my 2nd time and def not my last. I love the garlic noodles with beef. SOOOOOO GOOD!
author: Eshawn S.

description:
I've been to the Perilla on Irving in the Sunset, and in my opinion this new location on Haight isn't as good. Some major differences: the menu is a lot smaller, and it's counter-service. I'd also say this location is more casual - feels sort of like a fast-food place in terms of decor. 

I recently ordered the garlic noodles with five spice chicken, my go-to. The noodles and chicken were on par with the Irving location's, but the broccoli on the side was plain old cold. Granted, it's not the main part of the dish, but still, it's kind of weird to have cold steamed broccoli on your plate.
author: J L.

description: We have lived in Lower Haight for one month and since then have been trying all the great places in the neighborhood. We were craving pho and ordered takeout, which I picked up on my way home from the muni. I got the Spicy Chicken Noodle and he got the Beef Noodle. Huge portions and great broth! I am a huge fan of spicy food but didn't think the chicken was very spicy (they give you 4 jalapeños with), it also had some weird skin and chewy pieces but overall I liked the soup alot. He said his beef tasted like beef jerky but ate it all and said it helped his cold. We will most likely get this again because it's so close and the broth was good!
author: Meagan S.

description: Great food and very friendly staff.  Prices are a bit high but not relative to SF.
author: Sean Y.

description: Awesome noodles. Found out there was a bday in the group and just brought out ice cream and candle to be nice. Really great folks, awesome 3.50 beers, and nom food
author: Pete W.

description: Delicious Vietnamese food for delivery! I had ordered BBQ pork vermicelli and there BBQ pork spring rolls. This is by far the best delivery Vietnamese food I have ordered. The BBQ pork was tender and juicy, the spring rolls were on point. I am Vietnamese and this place actually fixed my craving for vermicelli. Would have been 5 stars but the price was just to ridiculous for 2 springs rolls. Overall if you don't mind the price this place will fix your vietnamese cravings.
author: Tri N.

description: Excellent!  Reasonable prices...friendly service...and the food was wonderful.  Had the veggie summer rolls and the 5 spice chicken with garlic noodles.  So darn good!  Very casual place. Order at the counter, choose your own table, and they bring it out to you.  We will be coming back here...a lot. :-)
author: Daniel A.

description:
The food is so-so, but it's a local vietnamese place and sometimes I get a craving.  I wouldn't take someone else here, but I like to go alone sometimes and just have a peaceful dinner by myself with a book.

Actually, my biggest request is that they not play a local radio station over the speakers, which tend to have ADHD inducing commercials when I'm trying to eat my dinner.  Maybe they could get a spotify account?
author: Erem Z.

description:
Apparently it's new in the area as testified by its cleanliness and bright colours but having said that the simple menu is fulfilled very well
We ordered the garlic noodles and pork with imperial roll to start .
The rolls were a bit thicker than our preference but that is a regional thing but they were well filled with nice complexity
The garlic noodles with pork had tender flavourful pork,a refreshing salad with a hint of mint and noodles that were very well prepared . 
For a quick meal it offered a lot of flavourService at the table was super fast and very friendly
author: Gilles B.

description:
Delicious beef noodles and empirial roles and the staff and service here are great! Nice ambience and close to home!
They missed an order and gave it to us for free! 
Great place we are definitely coming back!
author: Sydney L.

description: The garlic noodles are delicious, especially with 5 spice chicken.  But be prepared, that dish is probably 1,000 calories all in At least it comes with a broccoli crown to scrape the cholesterol out of your insides afterwards.
author: Rick B.

description: Absolutely nothing wrong with the food here! The shrimp rolls were super fresh and the garlic noodles with grilled pork was superb. I would only comment on the price; $27 for a beer, rolls, and noodles with pork. In the lower Haight. I know the neighborhood is changing, and perhaps this is totally driven by rents, but still, this is not what I expect around here. I would go certainly back, perhaps more demanding, but questioning, perhaps, value.
author: Ken K.

description: I had the beef and garlic noodles, beef was tender and seasoned well, garlic noodles were delicious as always, I frequent the location downtown and was stoked they moved to the Lower Haight.
author: Brandon A.

description: I love Perilla. The food is delicious, quick and the service is fantastic. I eat here weekly with my boyfriend and it never disappoints. Order the pork!
author: Ari W.

description: The people who run this restaurant or work here are just so good. The service is amazing. They are just a great restaurant for caring for the customer and making the customer want to come back. I was so impressed. Would thoroughly recommend these guys.
author: Joel C.

description: Ok...just ordered imperial rolls and pho to go via eat24. Because we did not ask for bean sprouts, cilantro, Jalapeños, lettuce, hoisin sauce, etc they didn't give it to us!!!!!!!  I mean...isn't it given...?  Hello are the peeps really Vietnamese?  And the pho tastes so bad!!!!!!!!!! They won't be getting out business no more!
author: Nina P.

description: DO NOT GO THERE!!! I am barely getting out of a 2 day very severe FOOD POISONING from the -overpriced- beef vermicelli. Been there a few times in the past and had a positive experience, the staff is nice, but won't give this place another chance.
author: Baptiste P.

description: Found it on groupon. Was curious and skeptical about the name for it is not a Vietnamese word. Found out the hard way. It is Chinese owned and they hardly speak English. The prices are high, but the quality and quantity are on the low end. This is not Vietnamese; It's Chinese food in disguise. Why can't they just come straight as Chinese instead of claiming something they're not? I ordered a beef noodle dish, which was supposed to be pho, but it turned out something as a bowl of skinny rice noodle in very thin chicken broth, with a side of grilled pork. Grilled pork doesn't go well with chicken broth based soup. Final words: overpriced (even with groupon), unauthentic, bad customer service. I was very hungry because I didn't eat anything all day till early evening; I came out of the restaurant even angrier lol. Not to mention 20 minutes circling around for parking to go to a place that is not worth going to.
author: Danny I.

description: I'd give it 3 stars, my date gives it 2.  We wanted Pho, but what they served was not pho.  They used fried chicken!! that's not right.  The broth was tasty.  The noodles OK.  Also got the shrimp rolls.  Pretty bland.
author: David F.

description: Awesome experience. Good food. Cold beer. Good prices. They even topped the meal off with a complimentary ice cream for a birthday in our group. Come here for good food and service.
author: Charles L.

description: I took my kids here for the first time and we were so happy to discover it.  We all loved the garlic noodles with five spice chicken.  My boys gobbled it up.  I had soup because I had a cold and it was incredibly good and nutritious.  The family who owns the place is super friendly and helpful.  They answered all our questions with patience and a smile. My kids were so excited that this restaurant is in their neighborhood.  THey asked if we could write a review so that other people will try it and it will stay in business!  We are going out to dinner there tonight and my kids have been looking forward to it all day.  They keep saying they can't wait for garlic noodles.  I am looking forward to it too.  It is a casual and yummy place to eat with good service.
author: Jennifer P.
